issue.message:
Library lint checks out of date; these checks **will be skipped**!
Lint found an issue registry (`androidx.fragment.lint.FragmentIssueRegistry`) which was compiled against an older version of lint than this one. This is usually fine, but not in this case; some basic verification shows that the lint check jar references (for example) the following API which is no longer valid in this version of lint: org.jetbrains.uast.kotlin.KotlinUClass: org.jetbrains.kotlin.psi.KtClassOrObject getKtClass() (Referenced from androidx/fragment/lint/OnCreateDialogIncorrectCallbackDetector$UastHandler.class)
Therefore, this lint check library is **not** included in analysis. This affects the following lint checks: `FragmentTagUsage` `FragmentAddMenuProvider` `FragmentBackPressedCallback` `FragmentLiveDataObserve` `UseRequireInsteadOfGet` `UseGetLayoutInflater` `DialogFragmentCallbacksDetector` `UnsafeRepeatOnLifecycleDetector` `DetachAndAttachSameFragment`
**This is a known bug which is already fixed in `androidx.fragment:fragment:1.5.1` and later**; update to that version. If you are not directly depending on this library but picking it up via a transitive dependency, explicitly add `implementation 'androidx.fragment:fragment:1.5.1'` (or later) to your build.gradle dependency block.
Version of Lint API this lint check is using is 11. The Lint API version currently running is 14 (8.0 and 8.1).
In Gradle projects, always use `http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto` for custom attributes

READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE is deprecated (and is not granted) when targeting Android 13+. If you need to query or interact with MediaStore or media files on the shared storage, you should instead use one or more new storage permissions: `READ_MEDIA_IMAGES`, `READ_MEDIA_VIDEO` or `READ_MEDIA_AUDIO`.
WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE is deprecated (and is not granted) when targeting Android 13+. If you need to write to shared storage, use the `MediaStore.createWriteRequest` intent.
Duplicate id `@+id/latestNewsImage2`, already defined earlier in this layout
Duplicate id `@+id/titleTextView2`, already defined earlier in this layout
Duplicate id `@+id/dateTextView2`, already defined earlier in this layout
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `capitalize(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `capitalize(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Avoid using `android.media.ExifInterface`; use `android.support.media.ExifInterface` instead

Use of `REQUEST_IGNORE_BATTERY_OPTIMIZATIONS` violates the Play Store Content Policy regarding acceptable use cases, as described in https://developer.android.com/training/monitoring-device-state/doze-standby.html
If you need access to FINE location, you must request both `ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION` and `ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION`
Avoid passing `null` as the view root (needed to resolve layout parameters on the inflated layout's root element)
Consider adding a `<queries>` declaration to your manifest when calling this \ method; see https://g.co/dev/packagevisibility for details

Use of this function is discouraged because resource reflection makes it harder to perform build optimizations and compile-time verification of code. It is much more efficient to retrieve resources by identifier (e.g. `R.foo.bar`) than by name (e.g. `getIdentifier("bar", "foo", null)`).

issue.errorLine1: android:text="Prospective Adoptive Parents (PAPs) are encouraged to book their appointments with the CSWDO officers as early as possible to secure their preferred schedule. Additionally, users must ensure that all uploaded documents are authentic, clear, and complete, as any falsified or inconsistent submission may result in rejection."
